properties.name: locale
properties.description: The current locale

properties.name: decimalSeparator
properties.description: locale separator for local decimal values

properties.name: groupingSeparator
properties.description: locale separator for grouping decimal values

properties.name: minimumFractionDigits
properties.description: minimum digits right to the decimal separator

properties.name: maximumFractionDigits
properties.description: maximum digits right to the decimal separator

properties.name: minimumIntegerDigits
properties.description: minimum digits left to the decimal separator to pad

properties.name: minimumSignificantDigits
properties.description: The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.

properties.name: maximumSignificantDigits
properties.description: The maximum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is minimumSignificantDigits.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: unit of the output (only used when `number-style="decimal"`)

properties.name: unitSeparator
properties.description: the separator to separate value and unit

properties.name: alwaysSign
properties.description: always put the sign at the beginning

properties.name: numberStyle
properties.description:
The formatting style to use. Possible values are "decimal" for plain number formatting, "currency" for currency formatting, and "percent" for percent formatting; the default is "decimal".
notice: min, max and step are not in percent (so e.g. if step is 0.01, it means that the step is 1%)

properties.name: useGrouping
properties.description: if true the number will be grouped according to the locale.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: The currency to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as "USD" for the US dollar, "EUR" for the euro, or "CNY" for the Chinese RMB â€” see http://www.currency-iso.org/en/home/tables/table-a1.html. There is no default value; if the style is "currency", the currency property must be provided.

properties.name: currencyDisplay
properties.description: How to display the currency in currency formatting. Possible values are "symbol" to use a localized currency symbol such as â‚¬, "code" to use the ISO currency code, "name" to use a localized currency name such as "dollar"; the default is "symbol".

properties.name: _numberOptions
properties.description: number format options

properties.name: formatNumber
properties.description: number format function

properties.name: parseNumber
properties.description: function to parse the input

properties.name: _regExpNotInNumber
properties.description: Regular Expression for non numeric signs

properties.name: min
properties.description: minimal input

properties.name: max
properties.description: maximal input

properties.name: step
properties.description: step for changing the input (referencing to `min` or `0`)

properties.name: stepMod
properties.description:
a step modifier. this is useful if you are having one step for multible elements that represent parts of numbers, like when you are having one input for the decimal part and one for the integer part.
For example:
  * if `step` is `0.002` and the `step-mod` is `1000`, `2` will be used
  * if `step` is `10` and the `step-mod` is `0.02`, `0.2` will be used

properties.name: _step
properties.description: the used step, product of stepMod and step

properties.name: value
properties.description: value of the input

properties.name: default
properties.description: default-value of the input

properties.name: saturate
properties.description: if true, the value does not revolve the range according to the maximum or the minimum

properties.name: noClamp
properties.description: if true, the value does not clamp according to the given step

properties.name: required
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: disables the input

properties.name: name
properties.description: name of the input

properties.name: _valueIsSet
properties.description: is true when the value is not undefined

properties.name: padLength
properties.description: length to pad the string (with `0`) according to the total amount of numbers

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: placeholder string

properties.name: autoPadding
properties.description: enables auto padding

properties.name: input
properties.description: string value of the input

properties.name: startAt
properties.description: start where to increment the value

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: minimum character width of the input

methods.name: _safeMult
methods.description: emulating handwritten multiplication to keep precision

methods.name: _safeAdd
methods.description: emulating handwritten addition to keep precision

methods.name: validate
methods.description: validates the input for iron-form

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: attach dom with `delegatesFocus: true` so that the element is also focussed while its's children are too, and to autofocus to first tabable

methods.name: focus
methods.description: focus the input

methods.name: blur
methods.description: focus the input

properties.description: is true when the value is not undefined

properties.name: padLength
properties.description: length to pad the string (with `0`) according to the total amount of numbers

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: placeholder string

properties.name: autoPadding
properties.description: enables auto padding

properties.name: input
properties.description: string value of the input

properties.name: startAt
properties.description: start where to increment the value

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: minimum character width of the input

methods.name: _safeMult
methods.description: emulating handwritten multiplication to keep precision

methods.name: _safeAdd
methods.description: emulating handwritten addition to keep precision

methods.name: validate
methods.description: validates the input for iron-form

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: attach dom with `delegatesFocus: true` so that the element is also focussed while its's children are too, and to autofocus to first tabable

methods.name: focus
methods.description: focus the input

methods.name: blur
methods.description: focus the input

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: The current locale

attributes.name: decimal-separator
attributes.description: locale separator for local decimal values

attributes.name: grouping-separator
attributes.description: locale separator for grouping decimal values

attributes.name: minimum-fraction-digits
attributes.description: minimum digits right to the decimal separator

attributes.name: maximum-fraction-digits
attributes.description: maximum digits right to the decimal separator

attributes.name: minimum-integer-digits
attributes.description: minimum digits left to the decimal separator to pad

attributes.name: minimum-significant-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.

attributes.name: maximum-significant-digits
attributes.description: The maximum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is minimumSignificantDigits.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: unit of the output (only used when `number-style="decimal"`)

attributes.name: unit-separator
attributes.description: the separator to separate value and unit

attributes.name: always-sign
attributes.description: always put the sign at the beginning

attributes.name: number-style
attributes.description: The formatting style to use. Is always `decimal` for `integer-input`.

attributes.name: use-grouping
attributes.description: if true the number will be grouped according to the locale.

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description: The currency to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as "USD" for the US dollar, "EUR" for the euro, or "CNY" for the Chinese RMB â€” see http://www.currency-iso.org/en/home/tables/table-a1.html. There is no default value; if the style is "currency", the currency property must be provided.

attributes.name: currency-display
attributes.description: How to display the currency in currency formatting. Possible values are "symbol" to use a localized currency symbol such as â‚¬, "code" to use the ISO currency code, "name" to use a localized currency name such as "dollar"; the default is "symbol".

attributes.name: format-number
attributes.description: number format function

attributes.name: parse-number
attributes.description: function to parse the input

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: minimal input

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: maximal input

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: step for changing the input (referencing to `min` or `0`)

attributes.name: step-mod
attributes.description:
a step modifier. this is useful if you are having one step for multible elements that represent parts of numbers, like when you are having one input for the decimal part and one for the integer part.
For example:
  * if `step` is `0.002` and the `step-mod` is `1000`, `2` will be used
  * if `step` is `10` and the `step-mod` is `0.02`, `0.2` will be used

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: value of the input

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: default-value of the input

attributes.name: saturate
attributes.description: if true, the value does not revolve the range according to the maximum or the minimum

attributes.name: no-clamp
attributes.description: if true, the value does not clamp according to the given step

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: required attribute

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: required attribute

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: disables the input

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: name of the input

attributes.name: pad-length
attributes.description: length to pad the string (with `0`) according to the total amount of numbers

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: placeholder string

attributes.name: auto-padding
attributes.description: enables auto padding

attributes.name: input
attributes.description: string value of the input

attributes.name: start-at
attributes.description: start where to increment the value

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: minimum character width of the input
